derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Venetian Italian, from Rhaeto-Romance gondolà 'to rock, roll'

entry.tran: （尤指威尼斯的）凤尾船，贡多拉
entry.def: A gondola is a long narrow boat that is used especially in Venice. It has a flat bottom and curves upwards at both ends. A person stands at one end of the boat and uses a long pole to move and steer it.

means.word_mean: 1. a low flat-bottomed freight car with fixed sides but no roof
2. long narrow flat-bottomed boat propelled by sculling; traditionally used on canals of Venice
3. car suspended from an airship and carrying personnel and cargo and power plant
